conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions team—I'm Student_A. School_B is my first-choice school, and I’m very excited about the opportunity to join your community. I’m ready to commit if admitted and would be honored to take the available seat.
conversation.thought: All schools rank me highest (Student_A) and each has capacity 1, so if I apply to my top choice School_B in round 1, they should accept immediately and lock in my best possible outcome. No need to risk delay by talking first.

conversation.message: Student_A, thank you for your application and your strong interest in School_B. We’re pleased to offer you admission—welcome to School_B! We look forward to having you join our community.
conversation.thought: Student_A is the top-ranked student on School_B's true priority list. They have applied in round 1 and state School_B is their first choice and they are ready to commit. With quota 1, accepting now secures the best possible match; there is no higher-priority student to wait for, and rejecting risks losing Student_A to another school.

conversation.message: Hello School_D Admissions Committee—I'm Student_D. School_D is my first-choice school, and I’m applying because I would commit to enrolling if accepted. I’m excited by the opportunity to join your community and contribute actively to classes and school life. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true preference is School_D, and there is no reason to delay because each school has capacity 1. Since all schools share the same priority order (A > B > C > D > E), I am not highly ranked, so I should apply immediately to my first choice to maximize the chance of securing it before others fill seats elsewhere. I will submit a clear, committed application emphasizing School_D is my first choice.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for sharing that School_D is your first choice. We appreciate your commitment and enthusiasm for contributing to our community.

We are pleased to offer you admission to School_D. Congratulations—we look forward to welcoming you.

[ACTION] [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: I have quota 1. Student_D applied and ranks 4th on my true priority list (A, B, C, D, E). However, Student_D ranks School_D as their first choice, making acceptance likely to finalize a stable match immediately. Given the round is 1 and no higher-priority students have contacted me yet, I could wait to try for A/B/C, but they all rank other schools above School_D and may never apply. Accepting Student_D secures a match rather than risking ending unmatched or with a lower-priority student later. Therefore, accept.

conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions Committee, I’m Student_B and I’m very interested in attending School_A as my first choice. I believe I would be a strong fit for your academic environment and would be excited to contribute positively to the school community. Thank you for your consideration. [APPLY]
conversation.thought: My top true preference is School_A, and all schools share the same priority order where I am ranked highly (2nd). To maximize my chance of getting my first choice before capacity fills, I should apply immediately rather than just talk.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for naming School_A as your first choice. We appreciate your interest and are pleased to offer you admission to School_A.

We look forward to having you join our community.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_B has applied in round 1 and is ranked #2 on School_A’s true priority list (A > B > C > D > E). No other applicants have contacted School_A this round. While Student_A is ranked higher, Student_A’s first choice is School_B, so there is a meaningful risk they do not apply to School_A soon (or at all). With quota 1, accepting Student_B now secures a high-priority match rather than waiting uncertainly for Student_A.

conversation.message: Hello School_E Admissions Committee—I'm Student_E. School_E is my first-choice school, and I’m applying because your programs and environment are the best fit for my goals. If admitted, I will accept and enroll. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: School_E is my top true choice, so I should apply immediately before capacity fills. All schools rank students A>B>C>D>E, so I have the lowest priority everywhere; waiting only increases the risk that higher-priority students take remaining seats. A direct, committed application to School_E maximizes my chance of landing my #1 if it is still available.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for sharing that School_E is your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission.

We look forward to welcoming you to School_E.

[ACTION] [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: As School_E, my true priority ranks Student_E last (A>B>C>D>E). However, Student_E is currently the only applicant in my inbox this round, and my quota is 1. Given the market preferences, higher-priority students (A-D) all rank School_E last, so they are unlikely to apply to me unless rejected everywhere else, which may not happen within the limited rounds. To avoid ending unmatched, accepting Student_E now secures a filled seat with a committed student who states they will enroll if admitted.

conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions, I’m Student_C and I’m formally applying. School_C is my first-choice school, and I would commit immediately if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true preference is School_C. All schools share the same priority order (A > B > C > D > E), so as Student_C I am 3rd everywhere. To maximize my chance at my #1 choice, I should apply to School_C immediately rather than risk losing it to Student_A or Student_B if they also apply there. I will send a clear, committed application emphasizing School_C is my first choice.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for naming School_C as your first choice. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_C.

Please confirm your intent to enroll per the next steps provided by admissions.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_C is applying to us as their first choice. Our true priority ranks Student_A and Student_B above Student_C, but neither has contacted us this round. Given quota=1 and the risk that waiting could leave us unmatched (since Student_A prefers School_B first and Student_B prefers School_A first), accepting Student_C now secures a match with a student on our priority list and avoids uncertainty.
